attributes.action: Make masks mandatory during class in the UK.
attributes.background: Make masks mandatory during class in secondary school. People are getting cases in different years and there are lots of ways to be in contact with them. Wearing masks during class period is the most effective way of not spreading it.
attributes.additional_details: There has been a covid case in another year - 8. I am in year 11 and have my PPEs in less than two months including my whole year. This can affect whether we can go to sixth form. The school going on lockdown will affect our learning and preparation since we won’t have a proper learning environment. Many of us have higher risk family members or are higher risk ourselves.

attributes.action: Extend the Furlough Scheme past the 31st of October
attributes.background: We want the furloughing scheme to be extended past the 31st of October 2020 to at least the 31st of February 2021, extending it by an extra four months.
attributes.additional_details:
The reason for this is not only because this provides needed clarity to businesses, especially small ones that were already entering a risky environment financially (even before COVID) but also to help those that would otherwise be unemployed.

It is not a worker's fault that a virus has led to a decrease in profit. It is not fair that they should suffer for the sake of "kickstarting the economy" quicker.

To deny an extension to this would be to prioritise profit over the welfare of the people.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/330657

attributes.action: The schools for young kids shouldn't be compulsory during pandemic
attributes.background: The education should be available in virtual environment.  Schools shouldn't be compulsory and parents shouldn't be forced to send their kids.  Those who want to send their kids to school, should be able to send but those who are worried during this pandemic should have been offered virtual lessons.
attributes.additional_details: Health of the human is more important than the education and the economy.  Rising Covid-19 cases and lack of experience in dealing with virus is a major cause of worry within parents. It is not possible to maintain social distance and even though kids may not be showing symptoms but they could be carrier and can infect the vulnurables.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334065

attributes.action: End the badger cull immediately
attributes.background:
A recent leaked document revealed that double the number of badgers will be killed in 2020 compared to 2019. A staggering 64,500 lives lost to this needless and scientifically unproven cull.

We demand that the Government immediately ends the badger cull and begins a phase of vaccinations.
attributes.additional_details:
In March 2020 the environment secretary stated how "No one wants to continue the cull of this protected species indefinitely" and in reply to another petition the Government responded that "The current intensive badger culling policy will be phased out in the next few years". 

This simply isn't good enough. A recent leaked document revealed that double the number of badgers will be killed in 2020 compared to 2019. A staggering 64,500 lives lost to this needless and scientifically unproven cull

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310307

attributes.action: Add colour Tarmac to the road where Gov are changing vehicle priority
attributes.background: Any Roads that are having changes made to the type of vehicles allowed or change of access should have a clear color change on the road, Signs are small and not always noticeable. and are often appearing on roads that people have used for years.
attributes.additional_details:
This scheme is meant to be about the environment not making money. clear visual markers are needed in the road.There are rainbows being painted in the road, so it is clearly possible. It needs to be a clear marker showing access is forbidden, with warning. 
As a business owner we have had  fines, the signage being used is small, and there is no warning until you have crossed the point. This is simply not fair on people, trying to work and earn a living, care for people or attend appointments

rejection.details:
The Government specifies how traffic signs have to be used for certain traffic restrictions, but decisions about which vehicles are allowed on local roads and how this is signposted to drivers, provided this is in line with Government regulations, are for individual local authorities, not the Government or House of Commons.

If you are unhappy with how roads in your area are being marked, you should contact your local authority about this.

attributes.action: Make useful adjustments 2021 A-Level examinations.
attributes.background:
We want :
Reform to the 2021 A-Level examinations. 
Current provision to be Reevaluated.
Delay to early application deadlines. 
More guidance to university 
applicants 
Acknowledgement of the difficulties faced by students (motivation is unrelated)
Meaningful change to be made to 2021 exams.
attributes.additional_details: The pandemic has been difficult for students. Many of us are trapped in difficult environments unable to study properly. We have been under immense stress.Many students were abandoned without access to remote learning, support, resources and the ability to meaningfully study. The current provisions outlined are not enough and the justifications were insulting. We cannot be expected to sit our examinations without meaningful change, without it the prospects of an entire generation will be stunted

attributes.action: Object to the five tower gas generated plant that is to be built on Weaver Vale
attributes.background: The five tower gas generator plant being built on green belt land in Runcorn and causing more pollution.
attributes.additional_details: Runcorn is already heavily polluted for a small town, we need to think of our environment, noise pollution, gas emissions, affecting the local wildlife.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Local planning issues are the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

Calling-in a planning decision

Once an application is made for the development to take place, all local residents have the right to request that a planning application be ‘called in’ by the Department for Housing, Communities and Local Government. This means that it will assess the planning application against certain criteria and decide if a full inquiry is needed. For more information, including the criteria and how to request the call in of a planning application, see:
 
http://researchbriefings.files.parliament.uk/documents/SN00930/SN00930.pdf 

You could also contact your local MP, who may wish to request the decision is called in if they agree with you. You can use this page to find out who your local MP is and how to contact them:
 
http://www.parliament.uk/mps-lords-and-offices/mps/ 


If you want the UK Government or Parliament to take action, for example to amend the legislation and policy framework which governs planning and development decisions taken by local authorities, you could start a new petition specifically asking for that action.

attributes.action: Replace or rebuild Hammersmith Bridge fit for purpose.
attributes.background: Immediately address the catastrophic impact that the closure of HB is having on hundreds of thousands of tax paying citizens / business owners / local residents. The impact on the surrounding areas beyond Hammersmith indicates a complete lack of concern for both the environment and the people of Ldn
attributes.additional_details:
Very simple - build a new modern bridge that works for cars, buses, cyclists, motorcyclists and pedestrians, allowing the use of what should be a main artery into London. 

It's time to put the needs of the people over the Council's obsession with heritage. 

The economy is on its knees: let's not make it even harder for a major developed city to run as it should. Allowing trade and business to resume. 

Easing an already congested city will help reduce to pollution in the surrounding areas.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for Transport for London and the local authority. 

You could start a petition calling for the Government to provide funding for a new bridge, if that's what you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Give Predicted Grades to BTEC (modules) & Alevel Students
attributes.background: I believe that the grades given to students are completely unfair. The government need to gift students with their predicted grades. Grades that have been predicted by teachers who are marking work, setting tests, by people who know the students.
attributes.additional_details: The government have deprived students of their potential initially setting up a generation to fail. A generation who has worked hard in a constant changing environment due to marking schemes changing half way through their exams; they had to meet new criteria. Then who are faced with months of missing school having to work from home, with less resources and lack of teacher contact, students with learning difficulties have struggled to soak in all the information needed to complete graded tasks. Students have been left to face with more change than the average adult within a professional working environment.Once points are lost for a grade students will not be able to recover them. Due to our heirarchy we have been graded wrongfully and the charts are our evidence...

attributes.action: Postpone/Change A Level Exams 2021
attributes.background: Extend the period of time that we have to take our exams so we are able to meet our teachers face-to-face and catch up on the work effectively. Alternatively, they should cut the content (as they have with 2021 GCSE students) so we’re less pressured to learn everything in the next 8 months.
attributes.additional_details:
The last 6 months have been a big struggle for many students, as not everyone’s home environment nor school is the same. Some students receive daily calls and meetings from their teachers to help them work while others are only left with a textbook and no communication at all. Some students have no internet access within their home which limits their learning.

The Government cannot rely on the students independent learning to carry them through their exams. This is not fair.

The eat out to help out scheme is pure black mail on business owners, forcing them to take part or else they can't compete with the 50 percent discount everywhere else, and no additional other offer of help from the government.

attributes.action: Give employees the right to work from home when they can
attributes.background: The Covid-19 pandemic has proven that nearly 50% of the working population are able to work from home effectively, and many employers are reviewing the need for offices. Government has said they may legislate on rights to work from home, but we call on them to bring this forward now.
attributes.additional_details: The potential benefits of working from home for a large proportion of the working population are numerous - helping people to achieve better work life balance - but also for the country - reducing pressure on infrastructure, rail and road, and reducing our carbon footprint to help the environment. Government should be supporting people to work from home proactively.

attributes.action: Change generic ‘may contain nuts’ on ingredients
attributes.background: Change the list of ingredients so manufacturers cannot write ‘may contain nuts’. For clarity for allergy sufferers, they must explicitly state whether nuts are used in the ingredients or whether the product has been made in a factory where nuts are used or where equipment may have been contaminated
attributes.additional_details: As a nut allergy sufferer shopping for food can be very stressful and confusing. It is not currently clear whether the product has nuts in it, therefore causing a reaction, or whether the product has been made in an environment where nuts are present. The difference is vital for allergy sufferers, as it eliminates the guesswork so often involved in food shopping with an allergy

rejection.details:
It is already a legal requirement for products that have to provide an ingredients list to highlight allergens in the list of ingredients.

Some food manufacturers also use voluntary labelling to indicate the possible accidental presence of an allergen in a food, using phrases such as 'may contain nuts'. The Food Standards Agency has produced guidance for the industry on allergen control, which includes advice on how to decide if such advisory labelling is needed and the wording to be used.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Make precautionary allergen labelling compulsory and more specific: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304265

attributes.action: Open Tattoo Studios in the UK.
attributes.background: Tattoo studios have absolutely no indication of when they can re-open. We have the most clean, sterile, safe environment out of any other business’s. Our equipment is 100% sterile, single use and every working area is deep cleaned with hospital standard cleaning equipment multiple times daily.
attributes.additional_details: Bars and hairdressers have been allowed to reopen, which is absolutely no different to tattoo studios in terms of working in close proximity with your client, and reduced social distance. The difference is, barber shops can see 20+ clients per barber, per day. Yet a standard tattoo studio ONE artist has ONE client per day. Our working environment is medically as clean as a hospital, 100% cleaner then pubs which have been given the opening nod over us. We NEED to reopen.

attributes.action: Allow reopening of UK Tattoo Studios
attributes.background: We would like ask the gov't to allow reopening of licensed tattoo studios
attributes.additional_details:
Tattoo studios are some of the cleanest and sterile environments in the UK. Whilst we cannot tattoo 2m away from our customers, the studios are cleaned first thing in the morning, multiple times throughout the day and again before closing.

Gloves are worn to prevent cross contamination, work surfaces are wrapped and covered, tattoo chairs are wrapped and covered, and all equipment is wrapped and covered. Everything is cleaned thoroughly after every customer and PPE can be worn during every procedure to minimise the transition of the virus.

People are struggling to survive without work, so if we can open restaurants, cinemas and other non essential stores that are dirtier than studios, why not open studios too?

attributes.action: Include the Tattoo and Piercing industry in the third phase of U.K re-opening.
attributes.background:
Include the Tattoo and Piercing industry in phase 3 of the U.K lock down re-opening.
The government must include Tattoo and Piercing shops in reopening phase 3, and remove any outdated bias or opinions that are clouding this decision.
Approve Tattoo and Piercing shops to open on July 4th.
attributes.additional_details:
The Tattoo and Piercing industry professionals have always safeguarded high hygiene standards for themselves and clients, are certified in cross contamination and pathogen training, and follow in-depth health and safety procedures. 
As such, Tattooers/Piercers are more qualified in infection prevention controls than Hair Salons, and we can prove the environment in which we work is already more than well equipped to reduce any infection risk.
PPE is already in use and can be easily increased.

The Government has published guidance for people who provide close contact services, including hairdressers, barbers, beauticians, tattooists, sports and massage therapists, dress fitters, tailors and fashion designers: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/working-safely-during-coronavirus-covid-19/close-contact-services

attributes.action: Reopen gyms and leisure facilities across the entire UK
attributes.background: Today’s reduction of lockdown measures is very welcome. The exclusion of gym and leisure facilities, devastating. These businesses have spent months preparing to operate within all the parameters previously set (2m spacing, reduced numbers inside at one time, additional deep cleaning routines)
attributes.additional_details:
The risk of transmission in these environments is no more, potentially lower, than many of the other attractions and facilities that are now invited to reopen, and have less stringent requirements to meet. 

It is not only the gym owners and PT’s that suffer, the communities they have built suffer too. Training isn’t just about fitness in one dimension, it is good for mental health as well as physical health. 

The industry has created a safe environment for us to recover in. Let them use it.

rejection.details: Since you started your petition gyms have been allowed to reopen. You can read the Government's announcement about the reopening of gyms here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-announces-gyms-and-pools-to-reopen-safely

attributes.action: Mental and Physical HEALTH for society by REOPENING GYMS!
attributes.background: We all do appreciate your intentions when it came to put England in Lock down, to keep all society safe, now please, appreciate our intentions to help our society to return to normal everyday routines, with reopening Gyms, where they can exercise, improve and feel natural high when doing that!
attributes.additional_details:
People in Parliament, people in their homes, on streets, at work... we all have one thing in common and it is common sense, which in this case has been neglected in my opinion by society's part which decides about everyone's future.
Gym-natural endorphins, improvements,large space, mental and physical growth! Pubs - limited space, alcohol(which definitely not causing people to stay 2m apart) uncontrolled environment, no matter how much owners are trying.

rejection.details: Since you started your petition gyms have been allowed to reopen. You can read the Government's announcement about the reopening of gyms here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-announces-gyms-and-pools-to-reopen-safely

attributes.action: Allow Cosmetic Tattoo Artists to go back to work on the 4th of July.
attributes.background: Allow Cosmetic Tattoo Artists to go back to work from the 4th of July.
attributes.additional_details:
As a Cosmetic Tattoo artist we are used to working to a very high hygienic standard. We wear full PPE and have a very strict clean down policy after each client before Covid 19. We work in a clinical environment with no soft furnishings and use medical grade disinfectant after each client. We are used to dealing with blood and are trained on blood born pathogens. 
We work on one client at a time rather than two like hairdressers.
We are more equipped and trained than hairdressers to go back to work safely.

attributes.action: National Campaign against general litter & fly-tipping.
attributes.background:
WE HAVE HAD ENOUGH RHETORIC:
Plastic-Bottle Banks.
A general reduction in packaging.
Reducing plastic production.
More enforcement officers to drive the message home.
(Significant attention needed on the abuse from motorists, on roads and parking areas.)
attributes.additional_details:
The threat to people's general health/wellbeing, environment issues etc’ not to mention the extra financial burden on our nation, is huge.
The majority of us have had to tolerate this unacceptable behaviour for far too long, now is the time to clamp down on these issues, this nation needs to clean-up urgently!
Please support us loud and clear from Parliament and together we can have an impact, isolated volunteer groups like 'Pick Up 4 Pendle' are limited, we are truly in this together and expect your full support!

rejection.details:
Increase penalties, enforcement and education to tackle littering & fly tipping:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324488

attributes.action: Private e-Scooters use to be legalised on Public Roads
attributes.background: e-Scooters should be made legal to use on Public Roads as a greener way of commuting to save the environment. For short distance travel (e.g travel to store, park, friend or place of work) I would prefer to use scooter rather than car.
attributes.additional_details:
Thoughout major cities in the world e-Scooters became very popular mode of transport for leisure and commuting. There are concerns regards safety, however introducing limit speeds for this type of transport would be safe alternative type of transportation. 

Setting scooter speed lit to 15mph on roads and bike lanes, would not disturb other vechicle users, and would quite safe to use.

To possibly extend that to pavements so it could be safely used, speed limit on pavements could be set to 8mph.

rejection.details:

attributes.action: Implement Vehicle Registration Printed on Drive-Thru Packaging
attributes.background:
There is a huge amount of littering from Drive-Thru packaging that has been a massive issue for many years and it needs to be looked into as it is continuous and by issuing fines could combat this litter.
This has an obvious negative effect on the environment, wildlife and is an absolute eye sore.
attributes.additional_details: With the government putting pressure on to fast food restaurants to implement Vehicle Registrations on packing where fines can be issued to individuals can act as a big deterrent.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324517

attributes.action: Preserve Gomm Valley as last chalk valley of BuckinghamShire
attributes.background: Government should stop any building plans in Gomm Valley, as it's a site of environmental importance, and last chalk valley in Buckinghamshire.
attributes.additional_details:
Government has provided guidance on population and housing needs in all areas of the country. These guidelines were created way before Brexit, and even before financial crisis. There have been many changes since, and more focus has gone on Environment. 
Government should provide guidance and evaluate any current masterplans for environmental impact and necessity.

rejection.details:
The development of land is a planning matter for local authorities, not the UK Government or Parliament. 

Parts of the Gomm Valley are already designated as a Site of Special Scientific Interest (SSSI) and an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB), and there are restrictions on what activity, including development of land, can take place on areas with these designations. These include a requirement to consult with Natural England before proceeding. 

You could therefore start a petition calling for a clearly defined extension of the Gomm Valley SSSI and/or AONB if that was something you wanted to happen. This could serve to further protect the area you are concerned about.

attributes.action: To make it statutory to teach racial equality in the Primary National Curriculum
attributes.background: The primary national curriculum does not make it a statutory requirement to teach about race and equality. The current statement "Teachers should take account of their duties under equal opportunities legislation, that covers race.." is not enough and specific lessons need to be taught on the matter
attributes.additional_details: The current events have highlighted that racial inequality is still an issue. This should NOT be happening in the world today. All people have the right to be equal to one another and feel safe. To achieve this we must start educating children at a younger age so they are able to understand in a safe environment before they are taught differently elsewhere.  Teachers have a platform that should be used to achieve change for the next generation.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Making the UK education curriculum more inclusive of BAME history: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323961

Teach Britain's colonial past as part of the UK's compulsory curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324092

We have also published several petitions about race and equality more widely, which you can view here: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions?state=open&topic=race-and-equality

attributes.action: Make teaching of Black & POC UK histories compulsory in the English curriculum
attributes.background: Britain benefited greatly from colonialism and slavery, and continued to benefit from the oppression of people of colour long after abolition. It is time the curriculum was changed to reflect this - people of colour must no longer be whitewashed from our history and our understanding.
attributes.additional_details: In today's climate it is increasingly important that our children grow up with a complete understanding of the role people of colour have played in British history. The BAME community have contributed to Britain's growth and wellbeing for centuries and yet this is not reflected in our teaching systems. This perpetuates a dangerously whitewashed view of our country's past and fosters a continually hostile modern environment.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of Disposable Barbecues
attributes.background:
We petition the uk government to ban the sale of disposable barbecues.
These cheap single use items are being misused and have caused many recent fires in parks and forests, resulting in long lasting damage to wildlife and the environment.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

attributes.action: Ban the use of disposable barbecues in public spaces.
attributes.background:
Sold as "disposable", these barbecues litter our parks and beaches but more importantly have caused hundreds of fires in moorlands, parks, and forests around the country. 
We want the Government to outright ban the use of these wasteful products in public spaces.
attributes.additional_details:
In the past week, there have been several fires in our countryside resulting in multiple hectares of land being burnt. 
During a time when emergency services are already under a lot of stress from Covid-19, it is more important now than ever to ban these disposable barbecues from being used in these spaces.
These disposable barbecues are also very wasteful and damage the environment when not properly disposed of. 

See for yourself. https://bit.ly/2Xlej7k

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

attributes.action: Protect sensitive habitats from sources of fire including disposable BBQ's
attributes.background: Our natural habitats are being burnt to destruction by fires caused by carelessness and negligence from disposable BBQ's and other sources.    The government needs to introduce special protection for our at risk areas and specific controls for the use of disposable BBQ's.
attributes.additional_details: An increase in natural wildfires combined with fires caused by human carelessness suggests we need to do more to protect our countryside from fire.  In May 2020 significant wildfires in the UK demonstrated the habitat damage that can be caused and the risk to life. With some potentially caused by disposable BBQ's we need further measures to protect our environment. Control of disposable BBQ's as well as introduction of designations and controls for at risk areas would be a start.

rejection.details:
We understand that you're concerned about fire in sensitive habitats, but we're not sure what specific action you'd like the UK Government or Parliament to take. 

You could start a new petition asking the UK Parliament or Government to fund fire control measures in sensitive habitats. 

You might like to sign and share this petition instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

attributes.action: Ban disposable barbecues.
attributes.background:
Ban disposable barbecues from UK shops and retailers.

Disposable barbecues can be bought for as little as £1. Even children can buy them. They are widely available in shops and supermarkets. They are often bought on impulse and alongside alcohol adding to the risk.
attributes.additional_details:
Disposable barbecues cause many UK wildfires. 4 months into 2019 there were 96 wildfires burning an area equivalent to 32,140 football pitches. The worst on UK record.

Cost to health, the environment, wildlife & economy is huge

Consider Saddleworth Moor & Winter Hill Fires in 2018.

9 deaths of people already in poor health

5m people exposed to PM2.5 (particlulate matter)

£21.1m economic impact

Huge losses to habitat and wildlife

Firefighting cost £1m

Climate change is making things worse

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

attributes.action: Intercept Bolsonaro’s plans to dismantle environmental protection
attributes.background: To mitigate President Bolsonaro and Minister Salles’ exploitation of the COVID-19 circumstances to deregulate legal protection of the Brazilian environment.
attributes.additional_details: Minister Salles’ has called for development of the Amazon, saying it is “necessary to lift people out of poverty” and that there is a “need to make an effort while we are in this calm moment in terms of press coverage, because they are only talking about COVID”. In lieu of the 55% increase in Amazon deforestation since 2020, the prospective plans from the Brazilian government could be devastating; for the Amazon rainforest and environments. Sign this petition to prevent further deregulation.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

The protection and development of the Amazon is a matter for the governments of jurisdictions which cover the Amazon, and not the Government or House of Commons.

attributes.action: Give clarity on the next steps of Year 12 students' future
attributes.background:
COVID-19 has altered the lives of Y12 students, without any security given.

The Government needs to give clarity and a plan about the new educational year for Y12s to ensure that students are protected from further pressure and stress about their future and exams.
attributes.additional_details:
COVID-19 will have long-lasting ramifications on society. However Y12, due to no government direction and despite lockdown introducing new mental health challenges, increased workload and pressures in home environments; Y12 students are still having to work on daily school work and revision. This is because we are unclear on how Y13 and after that will look like.

Y12s and schools can't assume that everything is going to be the same going forward, with exams, uni applications and post-18 plans.

rejection.details:
Decisions about exams are a matter for exam boards and individual schools, and are not a matter for the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Noise Nuisance act doesn't do enough to protect people from noisy neighbours
attributes.background: Give council enforcement officers more powers to enforce and catch neighbours making unreasonable noise nuisance from DIY or LOUD MUSIC preventing them from making peoples homes hostile and uninhabitable and causing serious health issues
attributes.additional_details:
On the spot fines Every time the officer deems the noise unreasonable 

At the moment the process is impossible to penalise these people the environment officer has to hear the noise several times before prosecution 

councils are short staffed and officers take hours to attend and witness these incident by which point the noise has normal ceased 

Allow submission of CCTV as evidence of noise disturbances

Look at how German laws protect there citizens and take a leaf out of there book

rejection.details:
Local authorities have a statutory obligation to investigate nuisances, including noise that could constitute a statutory nuisance, and current legislation already gives local authorities the power to enforce restrictions and issue fines if these are breached. Deciding when to use these powers is a matter for individual local authorities, and not the Government or House of Commons.

If a complainant feels that a local authority has not correctly dealt with
their concerns, they should contact it again to request further action. If a complainant remains unsatisfied having gone through all stages of
the Council’s complaints procedure, the Local Government Ombudsman
(LGO) may be able to investigate a complaint.

attributes.action: Create a 'Nightingale' Parliament to restart democratic debate during COVID-19.
attributes.background: Establish a 'pop-up' Parliament (like the Nightingale Hospitals) in an exhibition centre based on the design of the Bunderstag or Scottish debating chamber.  Individual seats and desks with microphones spaced according to social distancing rules with Cabinet and Speaker in a position of prominence.
attributes.additional_details: Nightingale Hospitals addressed the need to provide rapid care facilities, the same could be done for a 'pop-up' Parliament.  This would allow 'chamber based' debate to resume in a safe, clean, modern, high tech environment.  Exhibition centres in the UK are largely based near good transport hubs of bus, rail and road.  They have on-site hotels and other essential facilities.  With the Palace of Westminster not fit for purpose, perhaps this could also provide a long term model for the future?

attributes.action: Change the academic year to run January to December as a result of Covid-19.
attributes.background: When schools and other educational settings return on a full-time basis (probably after the 6 weeks holiday) students of all ages should rejoin the year which they left until December. This would allow them to finish their studies before moving into their next setting in January 2021.
attributes.additional_details: Students and teachers from all areas will be in a position where they will be catching up on missed learning for at least 18-months. At a time when the health and well-being of our population (especially the young and vulnerable) is of paramount importance we must think innovatively as to how to set those learners up for success. Pupils making those transitions between key phases in particular will benefit hugely from being given time to conclude their studies in a familiar environment.

attributes.action: Refund international students' tuition fees, include students in PSW visa scheme
attributes.background:
The universities have shuttered residence halls and moved courses online. The resources provided by university (labs, libraries) 
 are closed or heavily restricted. The students should be reimbursed of their tuition fees and all current students should be included in Post Study Work visa scheme.
attributes.additional_details:
Many of them have lost jobs outside and inside the campuses or are forced to work in high-risk environments. For international students, getting enrolled in a UK university is beyond the adventure of a new land to live but it is a stepping stone to a brighter future and an effort to gain student experience. 
They were hoping for a festive launch of meaningful career, now they are sitting jobless in deserted dorms and attend classes in Zoom. Some spirited young people have fallen ill.

attributes.action: Don't allow schools to reopen untill Coronovirus has gone from the UK.
attributes.background: Asking parents to send there children into a potentially lethal and dangerous environment is unacceptable. Asking school children especially young school children to understand and follow social distancing is ludicrous.
attributes.additional_details: We ask the government to imediatley withdraw the impending action to reopen schools on the 1st June untill such time as the threat of coronovirus is almost none existent (alert level one)
